==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|たん|はく|k2=ぱく}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=たんぱく}} compound {{m|zh|蛋白|tr=tan? bæk|lit=egg + white}}. The [[漢音#Japanese|kanʻon]] reading, so likely a later borrowing.

The {{m|en|protein}} sense is more recent, and developed out of the {{m|en|egg white}} sense.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|たんぱく|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|たんぱく|タンパク}}

# [[egg white]], [[albumen]]
# {{abbreviation of|lang=ja|sort=たんぱく|蛋白質|nodot=1}} (''tanpakushitsu''): [[protein]] {{qualifier|more common sense in modern Japanese}}

====Usage notes====
Due to the rarity of the first character {{m|ja|蛋}}, often spelled in [[katakana]], as {{m|ja|タンパク}}.

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|egg white}} {{ja-r|卵白|らんぱく}} {{qualifier|more common}}

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|蛋白|たんぱく}}: [[protein]]; [[egg white]]
* {{ja-r|蛋白質|たんぱくしつ}}: [[protein]]
* {{ja-r|蛋白尿|たんぱくにょう}}: [[albuminuria]]
* {{ja-r|蛋白分解酵素|たんぱく ぶんかい こうそ}}: [[protease]], an [[enzyme]] that breaks down [[protein]]
* {{ja-r|蛋白消化酵素|たんぱく しょうか こうそ}}: [[protease]], an [[enzyme]] that breaks down [[protein]]
* {{ja-r|蛋白石|たんぱくせき}}: [[opal]]
